titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cornwall Military Collection 1754-1953 MS 019 MS 019 MS 019
titlestmt.author: Processed by Ryan Bachman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2017-02-02 07:53:29 -0800.

did.unittitle: Cornwall Military Collection
did.abstract: This collection contains documents relating to Cornwall’s military history.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: This collection was begun by Cornwall historian E.C. Starr, but expanded and organized by subsequent historians and presidents of the Cornwall Historical Society, such as Emily E. Marsh and Barbara Gold.

archdesc.userestrict:
Use Restrictions Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Research library
Cornwall Historical Society
7 Pine Street
PO Box 115
Cornwall, CT 06753
Phone: 860-672-0505
E-mail: CornHistSoc@optonline.net

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Cornwall Military Collection; MS 019; box number; folder number; Cornwall Historical Society

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: This collection includes materials related to Cornwall from the French and Indian, American Revolution, and Civil Wars as well as World War I, the Cold War and the antebellum era. Topics covered also include the home front, wartime agriculture, and Cornwall servicemen.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection includes items associated with conflicts that Cornwall residents have taken part in from the French and Indian War up to the Cold War. Information about service-people’s gravesites is also included in this collection. Primary documents, such as commissions, orders, and military receipts are found within these documents, as are published accounts relating to Cornwall veterans. This collection also contains the military papers of Edward D. Cartwright, a Cornwall business-owner and captain in the Cornwall Company of the Connecticut Home Guard during World War I.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged chronologically by conflict then chronologically within each series.
The files are grouped into series:
